question: Which of the following gave Sher Shah Suri the title of Sher Khan for his bravery?
explanation: Sher Shah Suri was the son of Hasan Khan who was a jagirdar of Sasaram in South Bihar (Jaunpur). Sher Shah Suri served under the Afghan governor of Bihar named Bahar Khan Lohani, who gave him the title Sher Khan for his bravery as he killed a tiger.
